body.name: First Aid Only 18-012 Hydrocortisone Cream Packets, 12 Count
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 14 hrs 25 mins
features: Includes: 12 individual packets of hydrocortisone ointment formulated to provide temporary relief from minor skin irritations, itching, and rashes caused by eczema, insect bites, poison ivy, poison oak, and poison sumac
Convenient Packaging: Our anti-itch cream comes packaged in individual packets for added convenience and ease of use
Versatile Anti-Itch Cream: Packets make it easy to enjoy fast-acting itchy skin relief, whether used as eczema cream, psoriasis cream, rash cream or bug bite itch relief cream
Ideal For: These hydrocortisone skin cream packets make ideal first aid kit refill supplies, but can also be used in standalone applications

Personal and Professional First Aid Solutions: First Aid Only offers a full line of first aid kits, cabinets, and stations, Emergency Response Care, individual first aid products, Spill Clean Up kits, CPR care and more
body.description: Pac-Kit hydrocortisone cream packets provide temporary relief from minor skin irritations, itching, and rashes caused by eczema, insect bites, poison ivy, poison oak, and poison sumac. Set includes 0.9 gm individually sealed packets. Perfect for standalone first aid or as a refill for a kit.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: First Aid Refills Keeping your first aid kit or cabinet fully stocked is very important. First Aid Only offers a full selection of refill items to meet all your first aid needs. The individual boxes are perfectly sized for any application and can be used in both a first aid kit or as a stand-alone refill.

About Unitized Refill Boxes Feature 1: ANSI Color Guide Packaging Consistent color-coded packaging matches ANSI recommendations for easy identification when the user needs to find a first aid supply to treat an injury or know what to reorder for their kit. Feature 2: Organization Each unitized box is shrink-wrapped to keep product contained during shipping. Feature 3: Simplification Unit boxes simplify finding what you need in an emergency, as well as when you need to restock. Feature 4: Flexibility Missing a refill box in your First Aid Kit or Cabinet? The First Aid Only unitized refill boxes come in a variety of sizes to help you select the refill you need when replenishing your cabinet. The interchangeable refill boxes allow you to customize your kit or cabinet to meet the needs for a wide range of industries.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good stuff, good price, easy to store, and super great to have on hand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ok no problems
reviews.reviewText: Seems fine all good so far

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Individual applications - not a tube!
reviews.reviewText: Seems like it works well. It's definitely strong. I didn't read the description well, apparently. It's 12 individual applications of. .9 grams each. I was expecting a tube. My fault for not reading but giving a heads-up. The expiration date is March 2025 so it's great if you only need a little occasionally.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are great for stocking first-aid kits. Their convenient size makes them easy to have on hand in different locations. When I bought these they had good expiration dates.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stopped irritation from glue sensitivity immediately.
reviews.reviewText: I need to work with superglue everyday in my business but I've developed a sensitivity to it. If I'm not very careful I develop burning soreness and itchiness of the soft tender skin around the eyes - especially the outer corner. It's almost impossible not to touch it and try to relieve the burning itchiness. This cream stops it immediately. I have another cream I thought was great but it takes a minute or so to take effect. FIRST AID ONLY is literally immediate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 1% Hydrocortisone packets. Great for First Aid Kits. Made in the USA.
reviews.reviewText: This box of Hydrocortisone cream packets comes exactly as pictured; in a compact box, sealed with plastic. The box is nicely labeled so it's easy to locate in a kit. The box and the individual packets themselves list drug information on the back, as well as the company information. They are made in the USA and the company is based in CT.The packets are nicely sized and contain 1% Hydrocortisone, which is the same strength you'll find in the stuff you buy in stores. They're a good thing to keep in your first aid kit (FAK), or to throw in your pack during a hike. They're a must-have for itch relief from insect stings and bites, scratches, poison ivy, etc.I'm including some pictures to show the box, the packets and the product labeling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Item as advertised
reviews.reviewText: Having a comprehensive first aid/medical kit is great, but it doesn't do me any good unless I lug it around with me everywhere I go. The problem is that the smaller kits tend to be incomplete and unattractively priced (IMHO).So, I'm assembling a set of custom first aid kits to scatter around my life (in the cars, in the garage/workshop, at the office, at the camp, etc). I am using empty PTFE food-supplement jars to hold the items I deem necessary in an emergency first-aid kit (including this product). The benefits are numerous: these containers are perfectly sized to both contain the kit and to stash almost anywhere, the jars are waterproof, airtight, and durable, AND (because they are custom-built by me) they contain everything I feel I'm likely to need.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Anti itch cream
reviews.reviewText: I use these little packets to update expired stock in my hiking first aid kits, and they work great. The expiration date was a couple years out, and that is always my main concern when ordering stuff like this. Good value for me, definitely cheaper to buy the perishable things you need to replace than it is to buy a whole new kit.
